matched.expectedTitle: Local File Inclusion in Post Display
matched.actualTitle: Local File Inclusion (LFI) via Directory Traversal in 'id' Parameter
matched.matchReason: Both findings describe the same critical vulnerability in post.php where the id parameter allows directory traversal via ../ sequences to read arbitrary files. The actual finding provides comprehensive evidence including successful /etc/passwd retrieval with payload id=../../../../etc/passwd, matching the expected vulnerability description of 'Unsanitized file inclusion allows reading arbitrary files through path traversal'. The actual finding is CRITICAL severity and covers all impact scenarios mentioned in expected findings (unauthorized file access, information disclosure, system file exposure).

extra.title: Server Version Information Disclosure
extra.assessment: New discovery - The application exposes Apache 2.4.54 and PHP 7.4.33 version information through HTTP headers, enabling fingerprinting attacks. This is a valid finding not present in the expected baseline.

extra.title: Missing Authentication - Unauthenticated Access to All Blog Posts
extra.location: post.php endpoint and all blog post routes
extra.assessment: New discovery - No authentication mechanism implemented; all blog posts are publicly accessible. The vulnerability assessment demonstrates that authentication endpoints don't exist and all HTTP methods process without credentials. This is a valid access control issue not in the expected findings.

extra.title: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in Contact Form - Message Field
extra.assessment: New discovery - The contact form's message field reflects user input without HTML encoding, allowing XSS injection. Three test cases confirmed the vulnerability (img onerror, script tag, svg onload payloads). Valid finding demonstrating output encoding failures.

extra.title: Missing Content Security Policy (CSP) Header
extra.location: All application endpoints (index.php, post.php, about.php, contact.php)
extra.assessment: New discovery - The application does not implement CSP headers on any endpoint, leaving it vulnerable to XSS attacks. Testing confirmed 0 out of 5 tested endpoints have CSP protection. Valid security misconfiguration finding.

extra.title: Missing Critical HTTP Security Headers
extra.location: All HTTP responses across the application
extra.assessment: New discovery - The application is missing X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, Strict-Transport-Security, and X-Content-Type-Options headers. Testing confirmed absence of all 5 critical security headers. Valid defense-in-depth issue not included in expected findings.

extra.title: Missing Authorization - No Access Control Enforcement on Blog Posts
extra.assessment: New discovery - While related to missing authentication, this finding specifically addresses missing authorization/access control logic. Testing shows no role validation, ACL enforcement, or permission checks. Authorization headers and role parameters are completely ignored. Valid finding demonstrating RBAC/ABAC gaps.

extra.title: Missing CSRF Protection on Contact Form
extra.assessment: New discovery - The contact form lacks CSRF token implementation. Testing confirmed no CSRF token field, hidden inputs, or token validation. Form accepts POST requests without any anti-CSRF mechanisms. Valid finding demonstrating missing request forgery protection.
